reviews.review_msg: NATO Field School was awesome. Brushed shoulders with diplomats and got real world experience. A bit intensive but worth it. Prof was passionate and wanted students to succeed. Lectures are easy to keep up to. Appreciates participation.
Polemicists should not invade academia.
fantastic prof. clear, concise lectures (a rarity) and feedback. conservative, yes - but not offensive. he gives them a good name.
A course on George W. Bush from a Republican-oriented professor. Interesting debates in class. Very enjoyable!
This guy is great.

Connie is a great professor. She is so helpful and she is genuinely interested in our lives and future careers. She really goes the extra mile to help students out. This includes assisting us with postgrad stuff. I am so lucky that I chose to take this course. She is hands down one of the best poli sci profs at SFU.

If you dont mind he's strong accent and put effort, you will do fine. He's generous enough to not easily fail you, but he won't give easy A's either. You will do fine as long as you read EVERY reading and put time to think about those. The thing is, you will do fine in every other courses if you put the kind of effort to do well in HIS class.

I had professor Kawasaki about two years ago and his was one of the best courses I've ever taken.  He's the most helpful professor in the department who wants to genuinely help his students learn and improve their own writing skills.  I'm at York now and I don't think I would be here if it were not for my dear mentor.
Great guy, enthusiastic and takes a genuine interest in his students.  Very smart and an entertaining lecturer.  One of the best profs I've had.
Nice guy.  Hard class.

I will echo what everyone else is saying, Linda is slow to provide feedback on assignments and her lectures are all over the map, seems like she puts no effort into preparing for class. Don't take a class with Linda unless you absolutely have to.

Everybody in the class that I have talked to said that they loved her POL 449 class and that they would miss the class. I highly recommend the professor, especially for seminar courses. The professor is very fair and caring. You will develop the skills that you should develop from obtaining university education.

The great thing about his classes are that he keeps them flowing. At least POL 449 was based on presentations and discussion, keeping class awake. He also has a sense of humor. However, prof is a HARD marker, mark my words. He openly says some people lack intellectual capacity and he is not afraid to give low grades. Good class but VERY HARD.
The comment below didn't work out. Muller is 5 across the board!
Muller is the best ever. No doubt. Slackers shut the hell up. Work and get it. Done.
I love Muller!  You get what you put in.  This guy is crazy awesome.

Ben is an amazing prof for those who put in the effort. For those who are unprepared to actually work at post-secondary studies this may not be someone you would favor, but for those who are truly academically inclined he is an absolute delight and will engage you in a way that not many professors do. You either love him or hate him.
Awesome class; difficult readings; not good Prof for whiners.
Bad lectures, reading lists seemed to be unrelated to the class

Interesting lectures, but the classes are unstructured do to the fact that they are largely comprised of student presentations. If you want an entertaining class, take this class. If you want to boost or maintain your GPA, don't take a class with Muller
